title: Toronto QUEEN WEST Food Tour! Where To Eat & Drink in West Queen West Toronto!
description:
Where to eat in Toronto's Queen West? I went on a quick food crawl visiting a Michelin Recommended restaurant and a North America's 50 Best Bars bar.

Here are the spots in this Toronto West Queen West food tour:
1. Mother Cocktail Bar - 874 Queen St W, Toronto, Ontario M6J 1G3 - love the unique cocktails here and the dishes are quite creative too! Listed as one of North America's 50 Best Bars by
transcript: [Music] hey guys I'm walking along Queen Street West right now and I'm here to check out mother it's a cocktail bar and it's been named number 37 in North America's best 50 Bars by World 50 best group I can't wait to check it out it's been on my list for a while so I'm very excited [Music] and what's cool is they also give you a chocolate on the side to pair with the cocktail [Music] this is the Cameron Bridge Redemption it's part of their tanker region number 10 menu it has green watermelon celery Rose and more cherry [Music] this is unique is they use gen instead of Campari and they Infuse it with coffee bean so you will get some coffee paste LGH [Music] [Music] Ana [Music] hey guys mother is so good I highly recommend like the all the drinks I had were really good my top cocktail was the visions of Ooka and then I also really love the avogato martini if you love espresso Martini I highly recommend that the food I was also really surprised it was really good my favorites were the jerk chicken karage which is very unique a nice twist to jerk chicken and chicken karage and I also really love the Koji age Tartar and they gave a really good portion so it's good to share I can totally see how they made the North America's 50 best bars it's really creative drinks and really really good place I love the vice as well they have live music on Tuesday and Sunday as well so if you're into that check them out on those days okay so I'm still hungry so this is part two of dinner I'm here at Henry's it's a wine bar I've never been here before so I'm curious to try it's literally walking distance from Modern [Music] foreign bar I figured they had to get the wine this one is a Chilean I use Vanessa wine from the Pedro para Vineyards [Music] where she's fully and marinated in Florida [Music] this is Bubba's hot Fried Chicken so this is the grilled flat iron steak what really caught my eye on the fish is cow soy as a sauce which I find very unique there's crispy noodles on top and bok choy so this is the syrup it has white chocolate brownies coffee semifreddo and salted rice [Music] hey guys that was such a great dinner at Henry's I can see why they are Michelin recommended so they're actually in the Michelin guide I just noticed the sign on the restaurant I don't know that going into it so it's a good thing I ended up eating there the dishes are very unique I really really like the real flat iron steak because of the color soy twist that they added the bluefin tuna was also really good expect a more higher higher end pricing especially since I just came from mother so for example the church chicken garaga was 16 for like a lot of pieces whereas here the hot chicken was like twelve dollars for two pieces of the same size so that's the big difference between minor dining at Henry's versus us like mother but overall really enjoy my crawl and I hope you enjoyed watching this video if you want to see more food crawls in Toronto please like And subscribe and watch this next video right here

title: Michelin Nashville Fried Chicken! Toronto Food Tour: Bloor Street West!
description:
Looking for places to eat & drink in Toronto Bloor Street West? The Annex and Korea Town are one of Toronto's most diverse communities along bloor street west. And if you're looking for where to eat in Toronto's Annex and Koreatown, Travelling Foodie Raymond Cua takes you on a food crawl exploring four different restaurants and cafes.

As one of Toronto’s oldest neighbourhoods, the Annex has a nic
transcript: foreign hey guys come to join me on another Toronto food tour this time I'm checking out the annex neighborhood [Music] so I am here at Detroit noodle bowl it's located in Toronto with Annex and it's very near battery station so once you're off the station it's pretty much right at the intersection it's a new restaurant in Toronto open around three months ago I think so I thought I'd check it out I can't wait to try so I got there I eat handmade noodle soup with these and I also got the boiled dumpling with chili oil also spicy let's see how good it is [Music] [Music] that was such a great meal at such when noodle bowl highly recommend the handmade noodles it was perfectly Al Dente with a nice bounce the soup was so flavorful it wasn't spicy though I was very surprised so both are chili oil and the soup even though it looked very red it actually wasn't spicy to me I didn't even really need to drink water while I ate both dishes so I highly recommend trying to get the spicy because it's really not that spicy but because you got spicy you get the chili which means you get a more flavorful soup my only complaint really was the beef it was kind of tough and chewy so I wish they use a better cut or cook it a little better so it's more tender but otherwise it was a nice bowl of noodle soup so I also learned that they actually have their first location in Mississauga so this location at the annex is actually the first location in Toronto but the second in Canada The Boiled dumplings is also good it was nothing special it was like your typical dumplings but the chili oil it came with was very flavorful it also wasn't that spicy so I had leftover soup from the handmade Noodle and what I did was I added my dumplings to the soup to give it more flavor and then I added chili oil onto the soup as well so highly recommend doing that so I'm heading to my next stop and it's going to be Isabella's Mochi donut Boutique [Music] so I ended up getting the Uber to say the lecture as well as the Hong Kong milk tea coffee so I love that their flavors are more Asian inspired and I think it changes as well seasonally so can't wait to try so they don't allow dining at the store there's even a thing that says that so I was wandering around trying to look for a place to sit and eat the donut yeah those are some pretty good Mochi Donuts between the two flavors I prefer the Hong Kong milk tea coffee because I find it's less sweet and you have a nice coffee head and the Pea here as well the Uber was kind of sweet for me even though you do taste the Ube and I think it's because that made it really sweet For Me overall really Tasty Donuts I personally still think I prefer the ones I had in Japan I felt the ones in Japan had a nice crust like it was sort of crispy crust on the outside but then Mochi gooeyness and chewiness inside whereas here I felt it was consistently chewy all throughout even the crust and now that I've done with the syrup I kind of want to wash it down because it was still sweet I ate two Donuts so I'm gonna see if I can check out a cafe so I'm here checking out Russell and still Cafe it's one of the best cafes here in Toronto especially in the annex area I've been here multiple times before so I'm just back here to try a new drink that they haven't tried before I've had their pan done and Ube and potato latte before but I do want to try their Vietnamese coffee at the Vietnamese coffee was really good you get your choice between hot and Ice I would normally go for hot you get a stronger coffee flavor but since it was so hot today I ended up with the ice and you also get your choice between regular condensed milk or coconut condensed milk and I got the coconut water really tasty and really hit the spot since I was trying to wash down the sweetness from the donuts so I am here on my last stop which is chica's chicken it was the perfect sign for me because I've been wanting to visit chica's chicken after learning about it in the Michelin guy they got good man for their national hot fried chicken and their original location is in the junction which is kind of far and hard to keep DC into so when I was just walking around the annex and looking at Google Maps I saw there's a chica's chicken here and it's the second location so that is my science so I'm here right now on for my last stop [Music] so I got the OG bite and it was really really tasty very juicy meat and the breading was very crispy I actually think I would like the OG bites more than like a bone-in chicken even though a lot of therapy said to get the bone and chicken because I feel like the OG bites have a nice balance of like the crispy skin and meat a good ratio I got the medium level and it was nice and spicy not crazy spicy but you still get the kick and it was very flavorful one thing I would point out though is that I did find a bone while I was eating my bite so keep a look out if you are getting that I definitely do want to come back to try their OG chicken sandwich as well as their crispy waffle fries which a lot of people have raved about so I'll definitely be back hey guys I'm doing this thing where I'm actually doing the review after I've left the restaurant I've always found it kind of awkward to be sharing my thoughts good or bad while I I'm in the restaurant where the other people can hear me I always had to stop while I eat just to share my thoughts I find this is just better overalls let me know if you prefer this kind of format I hope you enjoyed eating with me in the annex neighborhood if you like this kind of Toronto food tour let me know in the comments below which neighborhood I should try next and be sure to like subscribe and watch this next video right here for more Toronto contest

title: My first DESI BURGER! Toronto Food Tour in Little India!
description: Where to eat in Toronto's Little India neighbourhood? I went on a quick food crawl visiting two places to eat in Little India. Here are the spots in this Toronto Little India food tour: 1. Lake Inez - 1471 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M4L 2A1 - We ordered majority of menu (7 of the 9) at Lake Inez so it was like a tasting menu for us LOL 2. Desi Burger - 1342 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M4L 1Z2 - Firs
transcript: hey guys let's go check out Lake Innes and Gerard Street East it's my first time trying this popular restaurant and I can't wait to try I think we're trying everything on the menu [Music] good [Music] Ness I know I said we might be trying everything on the menu but we ended up ordering seven out of the nine dishes on the menu so that's almost everything so overall I did enjoy the dishes my top picks are the beef tartar the shrimp corn pudding and the ribs is also really good overall it's good I don't think it's some a place I would keep going back to I know they changed many frequently but I think I've checked it off my list and that's good enough for me so we're still kind of hungry so we're checking out our second spot called Desi Burger I've never had Desi Burger before it's kinda curious what it is and what it tastes like [Music] so the Desi Burger is quite interesting so they mix minced beef and minced lentils along with some Indian herbs and spices to make the Patty and then they Grill it and once it's done they put in some vegetables and some sauce to make your burger so overall it was very flavorful I wasn't a fan of the Patty so I found the Patty very mushy very minced and that they didn't have any texture anymore and something that I look forward from a burger I also couldn't pick the beef for some reason so when I first bit into it I actually thought they made a mistake and gave me the veggie burger so I actually asked the stuff whether they gave me the wrong Burger but they said it's the beef so then it's not really for me because I couldn't even taste the beef but the flavors were really good but what I really enjoyed was the golgappy with the so flavorful and once you put the extra sauce on it on top it just bursts I remember the time I was in India and had Pani Puri as well it was so good and this really took me back to India I hope you enjoyed this mini food crawl of Little India it wasn't planned actually we were just supposed to do late enough but we were still hungry after so we squeezed in dashly Burger and if you enjoying this kind of Toronto Food Tours let me know which neighborhood you want me to check out next and in the meantime check out this video right here

geolocation.formatted_address: 1471 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M4L 2A1, Canada
geolocation.name: Lake Inez

geolocation.formatted_address: 1342 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M4L 1Z2, Canada
geolocation.name: Desi Burger

title: Toronto LITTLE PORTUGAL Food Tour - Travelling Foodie Toronto Vlog
description: Where to eat in Little Portugal, Toronto? I went on a Toronto Food Crawl visiting some of the best restaurants and places to eat & drink in Little Portugal. Welcome to Little Portugal, Toronto! Traditionally home to Portuguese and Brazilian people, this multicultural neighbourhood is filled amazing restaurants, bars, boutiques and traditional Portuguese bakeries.
transcript: hey guys this is raymond from traveling foodie and i'm here in little portugal to do a food crawl [Music] [Music] hey guys so i'm here in little portugal and i'm checking out bhairada tourist area so we ordered a couple of dishes one is the fried calamari and this is the shrimp and we also got the flaming sausage which is very cool i'll show you the video later off the flaming so this here is the choriko bombay which is the flaming sausage it's portuguese sausage that they flame with moonshine called bagako so this is what it looks like so it's very popped inside the sausage with meat but there's still some fat in it which is nice so it brings out some juiciness even taste the smokiness of the sausage but because of the flame and the bhagavata you also taste the alcohol which is really nice the next dish is the lulas frittas or the fried calamari so they actually use their homestyle batter the batter is light and fluffy the squid is really nice and it tastes the squid flavor and that's what i like i like calamari so you can still taste the freshness of the squid and it's paste they use the squid drinks instead of the tentacles or the other parts of the squid that's cut then i'll try the sauce very good then here we have the camaro which is the shrimp dish it's grilled and sauteed with garlic butter and it also has very interesting heineken beer sauce that's why i got this dish it's also listed on their menu as a top favorite so let's try the shrimps were nicely grilled you can really taste the heineken so if you love the taste of beer you would enjoy this the garlic butter adds a nice touch as well to the taste really yummy this hot sauce that they give you it's actually not spicy but it's so flavorful i actually like the calamari better with the hot sauce than the sauce that it came with hey guys i'm here to try toronto's hidden sushi joint located in this alleyway so i'm here at oroshi vishko it's owned by one of the top toronto chefs named chef jeff cow so inside you actually see it's just a small operation it's like a small fish shop and you see the chefs there making the sushi and this fish and you can see them slicing it and there's a refrigerator of aged fish which is what they are known for they also sell some merch some pantry items of different things but they also have drinks if you like for example the yuzu juice and milk tea so i got their omakase which is 4950 and it comes with 11 pieces of chef's choice sushi and a slice of tamago which is the egg and it also comes with a tamaki which is handrail sushi and this one here is a spicy tuna handle look how beautiful this is so we got a bunch of aged fish so here we have the ottoro chutoro akami hamachi king salmon striped bass squid which is the fish eggs and puni from mexico and the tomato so i'm going to start with the scallop the scallop is so fresh and so flavorful the rice actually has a more vinegary flavor so it kind of takes over the taste of the scallop as well this is the uni sea urchin from mexico this is the king salmon it's aged okay so the age taste actually shows you get a deeper richer taste than what you would normally get with fresh salmon i've saved the best for last the ultimate attorney see how fatty this is just melts in your mouth so good this is oh it's a diy handle [Music] so i'm here at foley brew pub it's a micro brewery and pub right in little portugal and right now from 3 to 6 pm they have happy hour so i got the cauli rice lager for 5.75 cheers so refreshing on hot day [Music] so i'm here at kalden's bakery which is one of the oldest portuguese bakeries and it's located in little portugal on dundas east west i got their portuguese egg tart which is pastel de natas for 1.70 so the crust is very flaky obviously arrived later it's not like very fresh anymore but it's still flaky it's not as hot feeling is very sweet and custardy [Music]

title: FRIENDS Experience Toronto FULL TOUR! The One In Toronto!
description: Love FRIENDS? Located in Yorkdale, The FRIENDS Experience: The One in Toronto is perfect for Friends fans to enjoy! You'll get to see set recreations, props, memorabilia, behind-the-scenes stuff, and a merch shop! Lots of photo opportunities at the Friends Experience Toronto like the iconic Fountain with couch, PIVOT scene, Chandler and Joey's Apartment, Monica's Kitchen, Central Perk and more!
transcript: hey guys guess where i am can i be any more excited i'm such a huge friends fan so i'm so excited to take you on a media preview of the friends experience the one in toronto hey guys this is raymond from travelling foodie and i'm here at the friends experience the one in toronto the friends experience center is running all the way to january 2023 and it's located in yorkdale right across from the lego store so here you'll find a lot of different set recreations as well as behind the scenes lots of photo opportunities if you're a friends fan you will love it there's a lot of different props costumes memorabilia and there's also a store that you can enjoy to buy some friends merch and the ticket goes for starting forty dollars are you're checking it out and what else is more iconic than the pivot scene this is one of my favorite scenes in friends then you've headed to joey tribbiani you've been bamboozled and this is the iconic scene where joey wears everything that chandler has i'm wearing everything you have and here is a wall of like interesting stuff that was said during the show so stuff that comes out is obviously how you doing oh my god unagi and there's some other ones that are more interesting that you may not notice it's like you know how phoebe said if it's a guy it's phoebo and if it's a girl it's phoebe and then here you have the sign when ross does a bad sign without telling you and now we're headed to chandler so here's the infamous pat the dog that joey bought and he gave to chandler even though chandler didn't really like it so you know how in chandler and joey's room there's an etch-a-sketch and it changes by episode or even during the episode so they actually recreated some of these ones and they also included the episode where you can find that specific etch-a-sketch and this one is funny it's the one with chandler in the box there is some interesting stuff for hardcore fans so for example you may not think the hockey stick is of value but this is the scene where joey actually gets trapped inside the cabinet and the guy actually steals their stuff from the living room and there's hugsy joey's penguin pal so i love the little stuff that they added the details are really here so for example when joey was making the cabinet and he actually cut through chandler's door and it's here so guys you also have the turkey that monica puts on her head so apparently normally you can actually wear it for photo opportunity but because of cover they ended up not doing it anymore we're now in the area with the one about monica geller and this is the iconic kitchen area in their apartment this is so cool tidying tips from monica geller i won't show everything but basically here's number one a place for everything and then it points to the closet space that nobody really knew what was inside until one day chandler decided to open it smelly cat what are they feeding you and the last spot is none other than the most iconic central perk and at the end of the experience you'll find the friends experience store where you can buy merch and exclusive items as well ones you can only find at the experience and even more exclusive ones specifically for the one in toronto if you're a big fan of friends like i do you will love it here tickets go for 40 dollars and above depending on the type of ticket you buy is it worth it let me know if you enjoy this content or find it very useful please smash the like button so that other people can enjoy you

geolocation.formatted_address: 52 Bathurst St, Toronto, ON M5V 2P7, Canada
geolocation.name: Central Cafe - Toronto Inc.

title: $20 Toronto Chinatown FOOD CHALLENGE! 5 Cheap Eats Toronto Food Tour!
description: Looking for cheap eats in Toronto Chinatown? I went on a Toronto Chinatown Food Crawl doing the $20 Food Challenge! Toronto Chinatown in Dundas and Spadina is one of the largest Chinatowns in North America and one of the oldest in Toronto! I was on a mission to do the $20 food challenge in Toronto Chinatown to eat as much food as I can as I do this food tour. Here's where I went in Toronto China
transcript: hey guys so i'm here in chinatown where i'll be spending 20 dollars to eat my way around the area [Music] hey guys this is raymond from traveling foodie and i'm here in front of chinatown located in dundas and spadina though there are several chinatowns in the city this is the main chinatown when people say toronto chinatown chinatown has a lot of different asian restaurants not just restaurants but also like nice specialty stores and bakery so i'm gonna be maximizing the 20 to try to get as much mileage i can visiting different places that i've tried and loved but also new places i've never tried before [Music] so our first stop is juicy dumplings they are actually for me one of the best value xiao long power places you can get in chinatown so you can get six pieces of these soup dumplings just for 3.99 at such a great value people have different ways of eating xiaolongbao but like they didn't provide any spoons because it was pretty crowded so we ended up leaving the place and finding random place to just sit shop so i like taking the top off first and then sucking the soup from it i know some people just put everything in their mouth or using a spoon but i do it the top way it's so good lots of soup inside the wrapper isn't that thick so you get a nice balance with the pork and the soup [Music] so now i'm here at hong kong dim sum house so they're pretty unique we're in they're a bakery but they also have a fast casual dim sum section where you can order different symptoms and you can get it to go and come to these tables to eat them so i got the beef ball so this is 4.49 so initially i wanted to get the deep fried shrimp dumplings but for 4.99 but it was sold out already so i ended up with this to fit the 20 limit so let's try so they are much smaller than what you would normally get in denson restaurant but the pace is actually there it's actually pretty good it's just smaller but you can't beat this since it's very [Music] so our third stop is and they're actually the og for ban meat in toronto so they're one of the oldest and they're also one of the cheapest so i got the barbecue part on this spicy but see how massive that is lots of filling the pork is underneath and it got spicy as well so let's try so you can see the amount of barbecue pork they have inside there's also the pate the liver patty that they use it's so flavorful you can taste the barbecue flavor as well plus i love cilantro but if you don't like it you can ask them to remove it so talk about inflation um before kovit when i went here last time it was still like 4.50 for for this and now it's six dollars it's still a really good sandwich and institution to visit in chinatown so here's what i got so far so it's a 3.99 for the juicy dumplings 4.29 for the beast ball at hong kong island district and it's six dollars for this one so 3.99 plus 4.29 is around let's tax it's like 9 35 something and then this is tax included already for six dollars the running total right now is 15.36 so i still have around four dollars and 54 cents to use up so let's see what i can do with that [Music] so our third stop is machine bakery so they is basically your traditional chinese bakery so you can get the buns tarts and stuff like that so i got a pineapple and pork bun and it's one dollar with tax already so let's try it's nice and fluffy you get the crispiness from the the pineapple part and the bottom part is really moist and nice so two bites in i'm still not on the pork side so i'll keep eating until the pork so we made it to the pork the pork filling is on the safer side not too sweet but i wish it had more of a like a grilled barbecue pork paste but still really good i really like the pineapple bun that it came with so right now i was around 4.65 cents left and then this is a dollar so i still have around 2.65 cents left so let's find some more places [Music] we just checked out the fifth stop in our list which was ding dong pastry so they're known for really really cheap chinese pastry so they have your usual buns um pineapple buns or steamed buns but they also have some interesting ones like this peanut butter sticky rice for 40 cents and it's very cheap and then then this one here is the tarot pastry for dollar twenty that's included already for both of these so it ended up being dollar sixty for both so i'm gonna try the sticky rice first so chewy and you can see the peanut butter inside i really really love this if you love like if you like mochi that's that's very chewy look how gooey this is like oh so so it turns out even though like i thought i was taking peanut butter sticky ball it's actually sesame inside but it's still really really good especially if you like sesame base it's roasted inside so now i'm trying the taro pastry i didn't see this a lot in the other bakeries we visited that's why i'm very curious and i love taro as well so it's actually a bowl of taro inside that's so cool i guess that's why it's a dollar twenty i was initially wondering why it was so expensive for a small piece of taro balls but yeah it's pure mashed taro inside so this can be very heavy because of this pure mashed taro inside so now i'm starting to feel full because of this but yeah if you love taro definitely try this [Music] so i had around two dollars and ten cents left so what i did was i went back to hong kong island dim sum house because i found they had one of the cheaper hong kong milk tea so this is the hot hong kong milky it's a dollar eighty for the large they didn't have the small which was dollar fifty so it's dollar eighty plus tax which is two two dollars and three cents so i ended up spending everything i had today totaling to 19.98 something i got it so close to twenty dollars so what a perfect day to spend the twenty dollars maximizing it as much as i can i hope you enjoy this video and if you find it useful please like and subscribe thank you [Music]

title: UKRAINIAN TAVERN in Toronto! Ukrainian Food at Barrel House Korchma!
description:
Looking for where to eat in Toronto for Ukrainian food? Located in Etobicoke, Barrel House Korchma is one of the best restaurants in Toronto specializing in authentic Ukrainian dishes like borscht, schnitzel, varenyky, cabbage rolls and more. And what's special is the pub is set as a traditional Ukrainian tavern! It's a great way to taste Ukrainian cuisine and culture.

Here's everything we ordere
transcript: [Music] hey guys this is rayman from traveling foodie so today i'm at marielle house porchma and actually korchama means tavern so the ambiance here looks like a tower really beautiful ambiance they even have like hooks over there and wine bottles these are sliced pictures and a lot of the tables are made with wood and we ordered a bunch of traditional ukrainian dishes in the menu if you look at the back it's actually in ukrainian as well so it's really targeted for ukrainian people so they have ukrainian beer on top and here in cayenne what they have is which they said this is dark beer here we have this traditional forest soup which is basically a beet soup with shredded cabbage veggies and there's also smoked pork in it and a server sour cream and two big buns here we have the reniki which is a ukrainian pierogi with potato cottage cheese and served with sour cream and this is topped with bacon beets and parmesan onion [Music] so we also got the porch schnitzel which is their deep fried breaded pork came with stir-fry sauerkraut and then we also got their traditional cabbage rolls which has rice and pork inside can't wait to try so here we have the chicken shashlik which is the traditional ukrainian grilled chicken skewer and we also got the ukrainian sausage and this is bigger than what you would normally expect for a sausage [Music] so these right here are the popular potato pancakes they get served as sour cream yummy [Music] it's crispy and with my favorite but i love the crispy top [Music]

geolocation.formatted_address: 2385 Lake Shore Blvd W, Etobicoke, ON M8V 1B7, Canada
geolocation.name: Barrel House Korchma

geolocation.formatted_address: 2385 Lake Shore Blvd W, Etobicoke, ON M8V 1B7, Canada
geolocation.name: Barrel House Korchma

title: BEST HOT POT in TORONTO? ROBOTS, NOODLE DANCE + FREE Massage and Manicure! HAIDILAO Hot Pot Toronto
description: Watch the Dancing Noodle Master whip the noodles to my camera! Love Hot Pot? This World Famous Hot Pot Chain from China is now in Toronto with a NOODLE DANCE from a noodle master! HaiDiLao Hot Pot also has premium meats and toppings, free massage and manicure and other amenities with robot waiters delivering your food! Enjoy fancy and futuristic dining experience at Hai Di Lao in Toronto!
transcript: hey guys so we're here at HaiDiLao which is one of the biggest chains for hot pot from china and we actually give you an apron to wear. Be safe from the splatter damage. so nice to be spoiled never get my nails done free manicure service and hand massage. I never get my nails done and they're so shiny hey guys so one thing that's cool about this place is you get a free hand massage which is what i'm about to do right now so let's check it out

geolocation.formatted_address: 237 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 1N8, Canada
geolocation.name: Haidilao Hot Pot Toronto Downtown

title: Toronto KOREATOWN North Food Tour | North York Food Crawl | Travelling Foodie Food Trip
description: Toronto Koreatown North Food Tour! Located in North York's Willowdale area, Koreatown North (or new Koreatown or uptown Koreatown or Little Korea North) is the span of Yonge Street from Sheppard to Finch Avenue (even up to Steeles). This cluster is not only filled with Korean businesses and restaurants but also general Asian spots.
transcript: hey guys this is Raymond from Travelling Foodie and today i'm doing another food crawl from Yonge and Finch area today we're checking out around seven different stops they're not all korean restaurants but Little Korea here has a lot of different variations of Asian cuisine, specialty shops and stuff so let's eat! So we're now here at our first stop which is chengdu wonton and they're known for sichuan dishes as well as a wide variety of wontons that you can try so let's check it out. I just finished the tai chi wonton and they're actually really delicious very flavorful very spicy though so that's why i'm speaking here now because i was coughing a while ago but it's very flavorful it had like cilantro, even baby bamboos from Fujian actually which is quite interesting. The soup is very flavorful there's potato noodles, beef and the pork wonton so try it! I'm trying this blueberry and cheese dorayaki from suntea. So our next stop is egg club and they specialize in korean style sandwiches and i'm trying the meat lovers which has smoked sausage patty, chipotle mayo, bacon and their special egg club sauce so they have their own version of hash brown and it's like hash brown base but there's also some potato so the base is nice and crispy this filling is kind of savory and sweet at the same time i don't care much about the filling so honestly i would still rather have mcdonald's hashbrowns over this. This is the meat lover sandwich and you can see the sausage the bacon the egg and the sauce. So i got the white dragon roll this is the roll i've tried like years ago and i really love it it has torched scallop on top with crab meat, shrimp tempura avocado and cucumber in a roll with spicy mayo. The recent food trend in toronto are korean hot dogs so i'm now here at arirang hot dog. They're actually a chain from korea and i'm trying their mozzarella cheese and half sausage hot dog. So i added cheddar cheese sauce, hot chili and honey butter so let's try. okay so it took some time but i finally reached the hot dog part so i kind of wish that they mixed the hot dog and mozzarella together instead of having top half being cheese and bottom half being hot dog because it becomes too much i personally would like to have hot dog and cheese in one bite and the hot dog part is much shorter than the cheese part as well. So our last stop for this food crawl is the good luck hong kong cafe which just opened recently in yonge and finch area and it's normally very packed with lineup so we're lucky that we are able to snag a spot. So let's check it out! hey guys Jon Mr. Dim Sum here. I've been here many many times and for a good reason because i really like this place so definitely come check it out. This is a big chicken cutlet with black truffle and cheese on rice. We tried the deep fried wonton which is a new item. Salted egg french toast, deep-fried milk, Hong Kong style curry fish ball

locations.tagLine: Known for Sichuan dishes and variety of wontons

geolocation.name: Chengdu Taste

geolocation.name: Egg Club

title: TORONTO FOOD TOUR! Brunch to Dinner in Downtown Toronto! Travelling Foodie Food Trip
description:
Toronto Food Tour: Come eat with me on a food crawl in Toronto! I haven't done this in a while so I was very excited to do one this year. I started at 11AM all the way until midnight of some of Toronto's best restaurants from cheap eats to fine dining including new restaurants!

In this Toronto food trip:
1. Milou: Met up with Yashy to start of the Toronto food tour with brunch at Milou where we t
transcript: hey everyone this is raymond from traveling foodie and today i'm doing a day of food tripping in downtown toronto i haven't done this in a while because of cobit so i'm very excited to check out a lot of different places here so let's go so i'm doing the food crawl with my good friend yashi and today we're doing four different stops in around three hours i'm hungry are you hungry i'm so hungry i didn't eat anything today yes okay let's go so we've got the mushroom thirteen which actually looks really delicious with the wild mushrooms on it and then we have the coconut sandwich which i don't know i don't know how it's going to be so we're trying the cockabine sandwich here so you get nice creaminess from the horseradish the chicken you actually taste the red wine which is a very nice contrast with the horseradish and lots of onions as well there's some pickled carrots really good sandwich [Music] it's dense but tangy and a little bit of a burnt taste too which actually goes really well [Music] hey guys so we're here at chen chan's nashvi

geolocation.formatted_address: 1375 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1Y3, Canada
geolocation.name: Milou

title: MICHELIN STAR Tasting Menu in Yorkville, Toronto! ENIGMA Fine Dining | Travelling Foodie
description:
Looking for Michelin Star restaurants in Toronto? Opened in 2020 in Toronto's historic Yorkville, Enigma Fine Dining is an intimate modern European fine dining restaurant offering seasonal tasting menu by South African Executive Chef Quinton Bennett.

On September 13, 2022, Enigma Fine Dining was awarded One Michelin Star!
